Articles.Content:
Welcome SSTO lovers , here I will show you my X-mini SSTO.

The X-mini SSTO is 3.61 T of pure shuttleness, able to take 1 kerbal to most orbits (for station docking)

With such ultralight weight, the X-mini is maybe the lightest functional SSTO ever (my jeb version even has less weight because the luck of wings less fuel and no docking port)

The X-mini uses a landing legs instead of heavy landing gears, so it is actually a VTOL.

Note* RCS is heavy so this plane has no RCS, you need to know to dock without RCS if you want to use it with your station.

owner manual:

action groups:

1) toggle jet

2) toggle rocket

3) toggle intakes

SSTO mission lines:

1) toggle jets and full throttle activate SAS and fly 70 degrees until you got 10000.

2) for every spare 1000 meters from 10000 go 10 degrees down (in 17000 stay 0 degrees)

3) earn some speed, you should have a APO of 100000-200000

4) after getting out of the atmosphere time warp to APO, circularize with the rocket and you done

5) for landing descent like a plane, than were you are lower than 1000 meters stall (pitch until you are vertical) and open the chute with space or abort.

6) open landing legs, use the jet, the rocket or both for slowing down before impact.

download link:

http://speedy.sh/5jUw8/X-mini.craft (no software needed , the website will give you the X-mini file)

Picture of the X-mini on the ISS:

Note* the small thing near the solar panels is actually the X-20 cargo SSTO , leaving the station after he brought the last module in.

Have fun

edit: The X-mini is able to get to almost any station, having more than 500 m/s DV in orbit.

edit 2: now used orbital mechanics to find out, He got 514.6 DV
